custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on the message inbox icon from the bottom navigation bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to view the first page of messages they've received as a list

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at a message in their inbox list that has not yet been read
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a the date highlighted in blue, indicating the message item is unread.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls further down their inbox list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to see more items from their inbox that did not fit on the first page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at their inbox list headers
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to see the date the message was received and headers that separate timeframes (e.g. Today, Yesterday, This Week, March)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a message in their inbox list
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to see the message details of the item selected

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates back from message details
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should return to the message inbox list,
If the message had not been previously viewed then it should now be marked as read and date should not be highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the message details they will have the option to tap a delete icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: If the delete icon is tapped the user should be presented with a confirmation dialog to delete the message and if confirmed the user returns to the message list and that message will no longer appear in the inbox

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing a Ticket Purchase or Ticket Forward message and taps on View Ticket(s)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the ticket list view of the selected game and be able to see all the relevant tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing a Check In message and taps on View Check-In
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the Event Details page of the selected game
